title: Can't build old pull request for Cargo with current nightly Rust.

labels.name: relnotes
labels.description: Marks issues that should be documented in the release notes of the next release.

body:
```
$ git fetch https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo refs/pull/2013/head
$ git checkout FETCH_HEAD
$ rustc --version
rustc 1.7.0 (a5d1e7a59 2016-02-29)
$ cargo build
...
src/bin/bench.rs:64:25: 64:32 warning: private type in public interface, #[warn(private_in_public)] on by default
src/bin/bench.rs:64:25: 64:32 warning: this was previously accepted by the compiler but is being phased out; it will become a hard error in a future release!
...
(success)
```

It builds, although with a deprecation warning.

Now trying with nightly:

```
$ multirust override nightly
multirust: using existing install for 'nightly'
multirust: override toolchain for '/mnt/src/git/cargo' set to 'nightly'
$ rustc --version
rustc 1.9.0-nightly (eabfc160f 2016-03-08)
$ cargo build
/home/vi/.multirust/toolchains/nightly/cargo/registry/src/github.com-48ad6e4054423464/regex-0.1.41/src/prefix.rs:46:12: 46:24 error: private type in public interface [E0446]
```

That's more or less expected,

```
$ rm Cargo.lock
$ cargo build
...
src/bin/cargo.rs:63:15: 63:20 error: Cannot declare a non-inline module inside a block unless it has a path attribute
src/bin/cargo.rs:63         $mac!(bench);
                                  ^~~~~
src/bin/cargo.rs:63:15: 63:20 note: Maybe `use` the module `bench` instead of redeclaring it
src/bin/cargo.rs:63         $mac!(bench);
...
```

but this is not. There was no warning about modules with stable. Also error message does not show macro context correctly (there is [X macro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X_Macro) `each_subcommand!` in use).

In up-to-date there are 3 invocations (one of which explicitly to declare a module) in use instead of two, so it is expected to work there, but maybe it has been turned into a hard error a bit too eagerly?
